titleStmt.title: The general history of Spain from the first peopling of it by Tubal, till the death of King Ferdinand, who united the crowns of Castile and Aragon : with a continuation to the death of King Philip III / written in Spanish by the R.F.F. John de Mariana ; to which are added, two supplements, the first by F. Ferdinand Camargo y Salcedo, the other by F. Basil Varen de Soto, bringing it down to the present reign ; the whole translated from the Spanish by Capt. John Stevens.
Historiae de rebus Hispaniae. English
titleStmt.author: Mariana, Juan de, 1535-1624.
Camargo y Salgado, Hernando, 1572-1652.
Varen de Soto, Basilio, d. 1673.
Stevens, John, d. 1726.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Richard Sare ... and Thomas Bennet ...,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Library of Congress.
Some pages stained with loss of text in filmed copy. Pages 150-165 and pages 70-end in supplement photographed from Cambridge University Library copy and inserted at end.
